title: Introducing: GLASS
content:
Featuring two former members of the criminally underrated Morning Runner (perhaps best known from the theme tune of The Inbetweeners), GLASS step it up a gear with their atmospheric prog-pop.

Their five debut tracks are characterised by the distinctive vocals of Matthew Greener and their alluring stadium rock sensibilities, switching effortlessly between synth heavy numbers (Signs And Wonders) and the more refined, Muse-esque track Everything Belongs.

As with Morning Runner, GLASS display a wondrous ability to perfect a winning song writing formula, however whether they have the breakthrough single will remain to be seen. Having been hindered first time around by overzealous label ambitions and the callous nature of the industry, these tracks certainly deserve attention, whether that be critical or commercial.
